conclusion: Analyze the path of the light ray and apply Snell's Law to find the refractive index.
The hemispherical medium has radius R, point D is on the arc surface, perpendicular distance from D to AC is sqrt(3)/2 R, and DE = sqrt(2)R.
Coordinates of point D are (-R/2, sqrt(3)/2 R) based on its position on the arc and distance from AC.
Angle of incidence i at point D is 60 degrees using sin i = opposite/hypotenuse = sqrt(3)/2.
Apply Snell's Law at point D: sin(theta) = (sqrt(3)/2)/n, where n is the refractive index.
Angle theta at point E is 45 degrees using cosine rule in triangle ODE.
Apply Snell's Law at point E: n sin 45 degrees = sin 45 degrees, solving gives n = sqrt(2).
The refractive index of the transparent medium is sqrt(2).
